narrative.title: NIH Data Management and Sharing Plan

question.text: Types and amount of scientific data expected to be generated in the project

json.answer: The project 'req_abda76a627' expects to generate a variety of scientific data, including demographic and clinical datasets, standardized anxiety and resilience scales, behavioral task data, physiological measures (e.g., heart rate variability), and derived summary variables. The estimated volume of these longitudinal multi-modal datasets is substantial, with physiological data and raw task files representing the largest portion of storage.

question.text: Scientific data that will be preserved and shared, and the rationale for doing so

json.answer: All scientific data generated from this project will be preserved and shared, including demographic and clinical datasets, standardized anxiety and resilience scales, behavioral task data, physiological measures, and derived summary variables. The rationale for sharing these data is to facilitate research on adolescent mental health, anxiety, and resilience mechanisms, and to enable the broader scientific community to build upon our findings.

question.text: Metadata, other relevant data, and associated documentation

json.answer:
To facilitate interpretation of the scientific data, we will make accessible the following metadata, other relevant data, and associated documentation: 
Study protocols
Data dictionary
README files
Informed consent documents
Survey tools and code (available via DOI)
Clinical lab test results
Intervention details
ELISA Assays
Neutralizing Antibody Titer Assays
Other relevant metadata as described in the study protocol.
